articles.title: HILL: Albertans will pay for Smith government’s red ink
articles.description: For decades, successive Alberta governments have failed to restrain spending during periods of relatively strong resource revenues. Instead, as money flows in, governments fall into the temptation to spend even more, which only leads to trouble when resource revenues inevitably decline.

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.
